How can I reset the state of an instance (if it is stuck in deleting state, for example)?

Networking
/ESX My ESX servers do not connect to the required networks with the same vmnics (eg one some servers MANAGEMENT is on vmnic0, on some others, it is on vmnic1) How do I cope with this ?

Christophe>> Create the MGMT-DVS dvswitch manually, populate it with the required portgroups. hosts and uplinks , then activate. Alternatively, you could make sure that each cluster only contains servers with the same connectivity and create one config-file per cluster. The latter is not recommended because you will have to use different names for the same entities (PGs)

When I use a floating IP for my instance I can reach the public network but when I remove the floating IP I can't. Should'nt I be able to do that?

Assigning a FIP allows the instance can be reached from the ourside world via FIP (ingress traffic). To reach the outside world from the instance (egress) traffic would go via SNAT. This should work irrespective whether FIP is assigned or not, as long as virtual router is assosicated with a particular network
Planning and Deploying
How can I make my Cinder block storage availability zone aware?

Cinder availability zones are not supported even in 3.0. One way to acheive this is configuring a VSA cluster per Failure zone, create a volume type per failure zone and use that volume type attaching the volumes to particular nova availabilty zone. It's a manual process and this configuration does not prevent attaching volumes of one failure zone to different nova availabilty zones

Can I create differentiated quality of service for data stored in CEPH? For example, higher performance for block and lower for Object?

If a machine crashes, how do I find out which VMs were on it so I can inform those users?

You can run nova list --host <hostname of failed compute node> --all-tenatns by sourcing admin credentials to get list of VMs running on that compute node. From UI, in the admin tab of the Horizon interface, client on instances. There is a filter to list the VMs running on particular host. The CLI command works in 2.1 as well.

Can I use Jumbo Frames for my VxLAN tenant networking? Will it improve my network performance?

You can't enable the Jumbo frames or MTU increase for a single neutron network. It needs to be enabled at the Entire L2 broadcast domain level. I.e From physical to interfaces in VMs. Details are available here: Higer MTU generally improves the performance of the networking but its application dependent.
